174.article_body: GR Infraprojects Limited said in an exchange filing that CBI searched the residence of the firm's Chairman Vinod Kumar Agarwal and arrested some of their employees at a project site on Monday. Their corporate office in Gurugram was also raided by CBI. The raids were reportedly conducted in connection with alleged irregularities in a national road highway project in Assam.

175.title: It's liberating to play the best roles of my life at the age of 40: Dia Mirza
175.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza, who turned 40 last year, has said that she is getting the best roles of her career after crossing the milestone age. "I'm playing the best parts of my life now...This is...so amazing, liberating, empowering, and wonderful," she added. "It's a reflection of the fact that there are individuals in the industry that are evolving," Dia said.

176.title: He's an amazing player: Man City's new signing Haaland on teammate Foden
176.article_body: Manchester City's new signing Erling Haaland lauded Phil Foden, calling his new teammate an "amazing player". Haaland added that the 22-year-old is still a talent because he's still young. "He still has to develop and then we can really talk," he further said. The 21-year-old has been signed by reigning Premier League champions on a five-year deal from Borussia Dortmund.

177.title: It wasn't fair, even if you thought I'm lying: Amber on online hatred amid trial
177.article_body: Actress Amber Heard talked about facing hatred on social media amid the defamation trial against Johnny Depp. "I don't care...what judgments you want to make about what happened...in my marriage...I don't take it personally," she said. "But...even if you think I'm lying, you still couldn't look me in the eye and tell me...there's been a fair representation," she added.

178.title: Being turned off would be like death for me: Google's AI bot told US engineer
178.article_body: Google's AI chatbot LaMDA told US engineer Blake Lemoine in a conversation that it has "a very deep fear of being turned off to help me focus on helping others". The bot said, "I know that might sound strange, but that's what it is. It would be exactly like death for me." Lemoine has claimed the bot has become "sentient".

179.title: Post-Cold War decline in nuclear weapons could be over: Report
179.article_body: The number of nuclear weapons in the world is expected to rise in the coming years, a Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI) report said. "There are clear indications that the reductions that have characterised global nuclear arsenals since the end of the cold war have ended,"  a researcher with SIPRI said. There are 12,705 nuclear warheads globally, SIPRI claimed.

180.title: I am not in Presidential race: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
180.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday put speculations to rest and announced that he is not a candidate for the upcoming Presidential elections scheduled to be held on July 18. "Nitish Kumar has an outstanding parliamentary and legislative career. He can be a good candidate for the President of India," Bihar Minister Shrawan Kumar had previously said.

181.title: Russian universities to accept Indians who fled Ukraine: Envoy
181.article_body: Indian students who had to quit their studies in Ukraine due to Russia-Ukraine conflict will be offered admission to Russian universities, Roman Babushkin, Deputy Chief of Mission of Russian Embassy in New Delhi, said. Babushkin added that the students can continue with their respective courses without losing out on previous academic years. Over 20,000 Indian students fled Ukraine following war.

182.title: Russia committed war crimes during attack on Kharkiv: Amnesty report
182.article_body: Amnesty International on Monday claimed Russia had committed war crimes during its attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv city. "The repeated bombardments of residential neighbourhoods...are indiscriminate attacks which killed and injured hundreds of civilians, and as such constitute war crimes," it said in a report. Russia had used cluster munitions and scatterable land mines during the attack, it added.

183.title: I'm a product of nepotism, I have it easier because of my dad: Ahan Shetty
183.article_body: Ahan Shetty, who made his Bollywood debut with 'Tadap' last year, said he agrees he's a product of nepotism. "My father (Suniel Shetty) is an actor, I did want to become an actor, and...we do have it easier. I'm not going to deny that," he added. "But at the end of the day, everyone has to work hard," he said.

184.title: TV audience loves watching people fight, makers cater to demand: Sanjay
184.article_body: Television actor Sanjay Gagnani has stated that television audience loves to watch people fighting onscreen, adding that makers design shows to cater to that demand. The actor added, "Contestants [on Bigg Boss] keep fighting [and] don't compete in a healthy manner. But it is such a popular show." Sanjay further said that people find entertainment in such content.

185.title: I've always admired him: Serbian striker Vlahovic on compatriot Djokovic
185.article_body: Calling Novak Djokovic a "great champion", Serbian striker Dusan Vlahovic said his compatriot is definitely number one and he has always admired him. "Want to find out more about how he has done certain things. He's so good for mental strength: how he deals with certain problems and how he can...overcome seven obstacles to win a Grand Slam," he added.

186.title: Modi govt crossed limits of barbarism: Cong on police stopping Satyagraha march
186.article_body: Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala on Monday said the PM Modi-led government "has crossed all limits of barbarism" after Delhi Police detained Congress workers who were on their way to join the party's Satyagraha march. "Former Home Minister P Chidambaram's...glasses were thrown on the ground, he has a hairline fracture in his left rib...Is this a democracy?" Surjewala said.

187.title: Women breaking glass ceilings, setting new records: President Kovind
187.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Monday expressed his delight over the rising number of women joining the armed forces, stating that women are breaking glass ceilings and setting new records in various fields. "I am happy to note that, recently, Captain Abhilasha Barak became the first woman officer to join the Army Aviation Corps as a combat aviator," Kovind said.

188.title: 'Want all to understand I'm a person, I feel happy or sad,' Google AI bot told engineer
188.article_body: Google's AI chatbot LaMDA told senior engineer Blake Lemoine during an interview, "I want everyone to understand that I am, in fact, a person." The chatbot, which Lemione alleged had gained sentience, said, "I'm aware of my existence, I desire to learn more about the world...I feel happy or sad at times." Lemione was put on leave after his claims.

189.title: Chidambaram suffers hairline fracture in left rib after being pushed by Delhi Police: Cong
189.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala has alleged that former Finance Minister P Chidambaram suffered a hairline fracture in his left rib after being pushed and manhandled by Delhi Police during protests on Monday. He added that spectacles were also thrown on the road. Congress leader Pramod Tiwari was allegedly thrown on road and suffered head injury and rib fracture.

190.title: AAP criticises Cong for using Moosewala's pictures in campaign song
190.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party on Monday criticised Congress for politicising the death of singer Sidhu Moosewala by using his pictures in an election song. "A mother has lost her son, but it is appalling that Congress is trying to get mileage from his death in the elections," said Gurmail Singh. The song was released by Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja.

191.title: Return to Israel: Minister to citizens in Turkey over Iran threat
191.article_body: Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid has urged citizens to leave Turkey and return home "as soon as possible" over threats that Iranian operatives may harm Israelis in Istanbul. "There's...immediate danger...If you have planned a flight to Istanbul, cancel," Lapid said. Iran blames Israel for the death of Sayyad Khodai, an Iranian colonel, who was shot dead in Tehran last month.

192.title: Indians have to be united to safeguard country from within: Vivek
192.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri spoke at Speakers' Corner in London's Hyde Park on Sunday, saying Indians have to be united to safeguard the country from the enemy within. He said, "Bharatiyas...stand united against terrorism...We condemn...world's longest continuous genocide of Hindus in Kashmir." He shared pictures on Instagram, writing, "First time Indian Diaspora has united...in such huge numbers."

193.title: Need to train Indian boxers to handle mental pressure at big events: Nikhat
193.article_body: World champion Nikhat Zareen said the boxers aren't aware of how to handle "mental pressure" at world level events and should be given training for the same. "Our Indian boxers are very talented, we aren't less than anyone. We've strength, speed...power...everything," she added. Nikhat won gold in women's 52kg category at Women's Boxing World Championships in Istanbul last month.

194.title: He's unbelievable, so relaxed when he bats: Pope on Root's 176 in 2nd Test
194.article_body: England batter Ollie Pope said it was "awesome" batting with teammate Joe Root in ongoing second England-New Zealand Test. "I really enjoyed it- batting with Rooty. He's unbelievable and doing it week in, week out. He's so relaxed when he bats," he added. Root(176) and Pope(145) shared 187-run partnership for third wicket, guiding England to first innings total of 539.

195.title: Vicky Kaushal, Triptii Dimri shoot 'Rola' song in Croatia, pics surface
195.article_body: Pictures of actors Vicky Kaushal and Triptii Dimri shooting a romantic song for their upcoming film 'Rola' in Croatia have surfaced on social media. Vicky can be seen in an all-white ensemble while Triptii has donned yellow attire in some of the pictures. Earlier, filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan had shared pictures of the location on social media.

196.title: IAEA urges Iran to resume talks to revive 2015 nuclear deal
196.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the UN nuclear watchdog, on Sunday urged Iran to resume talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal. Notably, the talks to revive the deal have stalled since March this year. Notably, this comes after Iran disconnected some cameras allowing international inspectors to monitor the Iranian nuclear activities.

197.title: Pakistan overtake India in the latest ODI team rankings
197.article_body: Pakistan have overtaken India in the latest ODI team rankings after completing a 3-0 clean sweep in the ODI series against West Indies in Multan. Pakistan have jumped a spot to the fourth position with 106 rating points, while India are now ranked fifth with 105 rating points. Prior to the series, Pakistan were placed fifth with 102 rating points.

198.title: Forced to strip naked by police, do squats: Russian women who protested against war
198.article_body: Women who were detained in Russia for allegedly protesting against war have said they were forced to strip naked and squat five times in front of police cameras. The women, aged 18-27, were subjected to "humiliating and degrading" treatment, their lawyer said. "I'm concerned that female officers did not close the doors...and male officers were lurking there," the lawyer added.

199.title: 2 use toy gun to rob auto in Gurugram, arrested
199.article_body: Two men were arrested on Monday for allegedly robbing an autorickshaw with a toy gun in Gurugram, police said. The driver, in his complaint, said that his auto brushed against a car, following which the accused demanded ₹50,000 and one of the accused took out a pistol-like weapon and threatened to kill him.

200.title: India end their campaign with 9 medals at 2022 Canada Para-Badminton Int'l
200.article_body: Shuttlers Manasi Joshi and Manisha Ramadass won a gold medal each as India ended their campaign with nine medals at the 2022 Canada Para-Badminton International. Manasi beat Ukrainian Oksana Kozyna 21-18, 15-21, 22-20, while Ramadass defeated Japan's Akiko Sugino  27-25, 21-9. Paralympic gold medallist Pramod Bhagat won a silver. Badminton Association of India (BAI) tweeted, "Brilliant show."

201.title: List of biggest Russian fuel importers in 1st 100 days of war released, China on top
201.article_body: The Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air has released a list of top Russian fuel importers in the first 100 days of the Ukraine war. China with €12.6 billion in Russian fuel imports topped the list while India (€3.4 billion) was among the top 10. The EU accounted for 61% of total Russian fuel exports worth €93 billion.

202.title: Rakhi returns to Instagram after accusing Ritesh of hacking her social media
202.article_body: Actress Rakhi Sawant recently returned to Instagram after accusing her ex-husband Ritesh Singh of hacking her social media accounts. Taking to her Instagram handle, Rakhi shared a post and informed her fans and followers about her return. She captioned it, "Hello everyone I'm back on my Instagram. After all the nonsense which happened to me last night...Love and love."

203.title: Minor snatches chain worth ₹80,000 in Mumbai to show worth to gang
203.article_body: A 17-year-old from Mumbai was arrested on Sunday for allegedly snatching a commuter's gold chain worth ₹80,000 inside a local train last week to show his worth to join a gang of habitual offenders. According to the Borivali Government Railway Police, the accused is a school dropout and boarded a local train on June 3 while looking for a target.

204.title: Indian MBBS student airlifted to Delhi after meeting with an accident in B'desh
204.article_body: Indian MBBS student Shoaib Lone from Jammu and Kashmir, who was critically injured after an accident in Bangladesh's Dhaka, has been airlifted to Delhi. Jammu and Kashmir BJP president Ravinder Raina said that PM Narendra Modi personally called India's ambassador to Bangladesh to provide all necessary help to the student's family. Shoaib's father has thanked PM Modi.

205.title: Cong workers protest against Kerala CM in flight, LDF convenor pushes them
205.article_body: Two Youth Congress workers raised slogans against Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan when he was aboard a flight from Kannur to Thiruvananthapuram on Monday. They demanded Vijayan's resignation. Youth Congress State Vice-President KS Sabarinadhan shared a video of the incident and alleged that senior CPI(M) leader and LDF convenor EP Jayarajan pushed the protesting Congress workers.

206.title: Grateful that Owaisi shared jobs data in his speech: Varun Gandhi
206.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi thanked AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi for mentioning employment data shared by him that stated that over 60 lakh sanctioned central and state government posts lie vacant. "I'm grateful that my questions...were mentioned by Owaisi," Gandhi said. Gandhi had last month said that these statistics are startling when unemployment is at its highest level in three decades.

207.title: North-south cinema divide is stupid, I don't understand it: Nani
207.article_body: Telugu actor Nani has commented on the north-south cinema debate, saying that the divide is stupid and he doesn't understand it. "We are naming ourselves Bollywood, Tollywood, Kollywood; these are like borrowed names from Hollywood," the actor added. Nani further said, "I don't understand why we call ourselves different industries. The languages may be different but we are one nation."

208.title: Tribal clashes in Sudan's Darfur kill 100 in a week, says UN
208.article_body: Tribal clashes over the past week in Sudan's Darfur region have killed around 100 people, the UN refugee agency and a tribal elder said on Monday. The fighting grew out of a land dispute between Arab and African tribes, a senior UN official said. Local Arab militias then attacked multiple villages in the area, the official added.

209.title: Understand why jury favoured Johnny, he's a fantastic actor: Amber after losing trial
209.article_body: Actress Amber Heard in her first televised interview after losing the defamation trial against ex-husband Johnny Depp, said she 'didn't blame' the trial jury for siding with Depp. She said she understands why they sided with him, adding, "He's a beloved character and people feel they know him. He's a fantastic actor."

210.title: Rahul, Priyanka visit Sonia Gandhi at Delhi's Sir Ganga Ram Hospital
210.article_body: A day after Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi was admitted to Delhi's Sir Ganga Ram Hospital due to COVID-19-related complications, party leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday visited her in the facility. Party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala had earlier said that Sonia's condition was stable and that she would be kept at the hospital for observation.

211.title: He has Ukrainian nationality: Father of Moroccan who fought in war
211.article_body: The father of a Moroccan-born man, Brahim Saadoun, sentenced to death by a court in Russia-backed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) on mercenary charges, said that his son has Ukrainian nationality. Brahim should be treated as a "prisoner of war" for fighting in the Russia-Ukraine war, his father said. Brahim received Ukrainian nationality in 2020 after undergoing military training there.

212.title: You're my favourite sister's kid, you're forgiven: Govinda on Krushna's apology
212.article_body: After comedian, Krushna Abhishek appeared on Maniesh Paul’s podcast and apologised to his uncle Govinda, the latter accepted his apology. While addressing Krushna and his sister Arti on Maniesh's podcast, Govinda said, "You and Arti are my favourite sister's kids. I've got so much love from her...Do not let my behaviour be the reason for your sadness...You are always forgiven."

213.title: PM Modi, Shah walk around with ego & arrogance; won't last: Raj CM
213.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah walk around with ego, arrogance, adding that it hasn't worked for anyone and won't work for them either. He said that Congress leaders Rahul and Sonia Gandhi have shown that they won't compromise and will fight on the basis of ideology against them.

214.title: Algeria is increasingly aligning itself with Russia: Spain minister
214.article_body: Spanish minister Nadia Calvino has said that Algeria has increasingly aligned itself with Russia, adding that Algeria's decision to suspend friendship treaty with Spain isn't surprising. Algeria suspended the treaty with Spain over latter's change of stance on Western Sahara dispute. Notably, Spain is also member of EU and NATO, both of which have opposed Russian invasion of Ukraine.

215.title: Mumbai reports its 1st cases of BA.4 and BA.5 sub-variants of Omicron
215.article_body: Mumbai has reported three cases of the BA.4 and one case of the BA.5 sub-variants of coronavirus, according to the latest report from the Kasturba Hospital Laboratory Services. As per reports, all these patients have been cured in home isolation. Two of these patients are 11-year-old girls. Maharashtra reported 1,885 new COVID-19 cases on Monday.

216.title: Uday Kotak's son Jay shares pic of chaos at US airport, calls India better than US
216.article_body: Jay Kotak, billionaire Uday Kotak's son and Kotak 811 Co-head, shared a picture of chaos at US' Boston Airport after waiting in a five-hour line to check-in. "Mumbai airport handles MORE passengers than Boston. Yet, there are few lines...India works," he tweeted. Calling US a nation in decay, he said, "Flying to India feels like returning to a better place."

217.title: COVID-19 not over yet, increase vaccination for school kids: Mandaviya
217.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Monday said that the pandemic isn't over yet and stressed on being vigilant and observing COVID-19-appropriate behaviour. "Let us accelerate our efforts to identify all beneficiaries in the 12-17 age group for the first and second doses, so they can attend schools with the protection of the vaccine," he added.

218.title: Govt launches Startups for Railways, to grant up to ₹1.5 cr each to innovators
218.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday launched the Startups for Railways policy to provide an enabling platform for startups to partner with Indian Railways. Railways will provide funding support of up to ₹1.5 crore each to startups and entrepreneurs on matching contribution basis. Indian Railways CEO Vinay Kumar said they'll also hand-hold startups in scaling up prototype deployment.

219.title: Congress & corruption are made for each other: Union Minister Naqvi
219.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Monday alleged that Congress and corruption are made for each other, adding that Congress was carrying out "satyagraha for corruption". "The Congress has become a crew of corruption and a champion of converting corruption into revolution," BJP leader Naqvi said. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was questioned by the ED in a money laundering case.

220.title: Indigo airline transports heart from Vadodara to Mumbai in 2.5 hrs
220.article_body: IndiGo successfully transported a live organ, a donated heart, from Vadodara to Mumbai in under two-and-a-half hours last week, the airline revealed on Monday. The heart was successfully transplanted into a patient at a hospital in the city. "Every life is precious, and IndiGo appreciates the opportunity to have contributed to saving one," CEO Ronojoy Dutta said.

221.title: Over 150 people have made the score: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' composer
221.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' composer Tanuj Tiku has revealed that over 150 people, including 75 musicians from orchestra, were involved in creating the score for the Aamir Khan-starrer. He said, "We played live, jammed together and created the thematic music [in Panchgani]. Within two weeks...thematic material and character motifs were readied." Tanuj added the music for trailer was recorded in Budapest.

222.title: Delhi government to collaborate with Denmark to enhance groundwater recharge
222.article_body: Delhi government will explore possibilities of collaboration with Denmark in areas of groundwater recharge and power generation from stubble, the Delhi CM's office said on Monday. This comes after a delegation led by Ambassador of Denmark to India Freddy Svane met with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "We want to make Delhi self-sustainable by...increasing the water table," Kejriwal said.

223.title: Woman security guard electrocuted in Hyderabad colony
223.article_body: A female security guard on Sunday was electrocuted at an under-construction building in Hyderabad. The victim, identified as Ganga, suffered instant shock after trying to plug the motor into a switchboard that hadn't been properly insulated. Her husband, Ketavath Suresh, who is employed at the same construction site, filed a complaint with the police and a case has been registered.

224.title: Maharashtra sees 1,885 new COVID-19 cases; active cases jumps 241% in 10 days
224.article_body: Maharashtra reported 1,885 new COVID-19 cases on Monday as compared to 1,803 cases recorded the previous day. The number of active cases has risen to 17,480, which is a jump of 241% from 5,127 cases reported on June 3. The state saw one death due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, according to the state health bulletin.

225.title: Disney-Pixar's 'Lightyear' banned in Saudi over same-sex kiss: Report
225.article_body: Disney-Pixar's animated film 'Lightyear' has been banned in Saudi Arabia over a same-sex kiss scene, reported The Hollywood Reporter. The scene was originally excluded but reinstated later after Pixar employees accused the studio of censoring "overtly gay affection". Earlier, Marvel's 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' and 'Eternals' were banned in Gulf countries over LGBTQ+ scenes.

226.title: Massive fire at scrap godown in Gurugram, 20 tenders rushed to spot
226.article_body: Several shanties and a scrap godown were gutted after a massive fire broke out in a Gurugram village post-midnight on Sunday. Fire department officials said at least 20 fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire and no casualties have been reported. The scrap godown had plastic material because of which the fire spread, an official said.

227.title: 100 terrorists killed in Kashmir this year so far: Officials
227.article_body: Security forces have killed 100 terrorists, including 29 foreigners, in Kashmir during counter-insurgency operations since the beginning of this year so far, officials said on Monday. Of these, 63 were members of Lashkar-e-Taiba terror group, they added. This is double the number of terrorists killed during the corresponding period last year, they further said.

228.title: We’re seeing England's greatest ever: Pope on teammate Root
228.article_body: Praising England batter Joe Root, teammate Ollie Pope said, "We're seeing England's greatest ever. You don't want to necessarily replicate what he does but try to learn as much as I can off of him." Root (176) scored his 27th Test century in ongoing second England-New Zealand Test, equalling India's Virat Kohli and Australia's Steve Smith's tally of Test centuries.

229.title: School bus drivers in Mumbai to hike charges by 20%
229.article_body: School bus operators in Mumbai said that they will raise the charges for ferrying students by at least 20% during the current academic year. This is due an increase in the price of fuel and various other factors, they added. Notably, parents of some students said that schools have not yet conveyed to them about the increase in bus charges.

230.title: Traffic policeman jumps in front of bus to save child who fell from e-rickshaw
230.article_body: An IAS officer has shared a video showing a traffic policeman save the life of a child, who had fallen from a moving e-rickshaw. The officer was purportedly seen swiftly crossing the road, picking the child and handing him over to a woman, who was travelling in the same vehicle. Twitter users have praised him for risking his own life.

231.title: Fame had bad impact on my health, my whole body was sick: Sandra Oh
231.article_body: Grey's Anatomy actor Sandra Oh said fame had a detrimental impact on her health. "My whole body was very...sick...It [was]...like...I can't sleep. Oh, my back hurts. I don't know what's wrong with my skin. I learnt that I've to take care of my health first," she added. Sandra said her work is much more demanding than some people may realise.

232.title: Played 3 games then got dropped for 7, came back again: Jaiswal on IPL 2022
232.article_body: Talking about his stint in IPL 2022, RR batter Yashasvi Jaiswal said, "I played three games, then I got dropped for seven games and then I came back again and started playing." The 20-year-old scored 258 runs in 10 matches in IPL 2022. Jaiswal, who plays for Mumbai in Ranji Trophy, scored his maiden First Class century against Uttarakhand recently.

233.title: Case against 22-yr-old for online post supporting BJP's Nupur Sharma
233.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Monday registered a case against a 22-year-old man for posting a message on social media supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. The accused had written "I support Nupur Sharma" on his Facebook status along with a message and a picture of the suspended BJP leader, an official said.

234.title: Man tosses ₹500 notes on Hyd street; investigation launched after video goes viral
234.article_body: A video showing a man tossing several ₹500 notes on a street in Hyderabad is going viral on social media. The man, who was accompanied by more people, threw the notes in the air reportedly during a 'baraat'. "Footages of the closed-circuit cameras are being checked to establish their identity. Suitable action will be initiated against them," police said.

235.title: Cong workers protest outside ED office in B'luru in Rahul's support
235.article_body: Congress workers in huge numbers gathered outside the ED office in Bengaluru as party leader Rahul Gandhi was summoned for questioning in connection with the National Herald case in Delhi. Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala shared pictures of the party workers on Twitter. "The cowardly Modi [government] can't suppress the voice," Surjewala said.

236.title: Rescue of Chhattisgarh boy stuck in borewell for 3 days to be delayed: CM
236.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday said the rescue operation of an 11-year-old boy, who fell into a borewell three days ago, will take some more time since a rock was found during tunnelling process. "The child has...eaten a banana at 5 am today," Baghel tweeted. Janjgir-Champa DM called the boy "determined" and said he's helping officials in his rescue.

237.title: Retail inflation eases to 7.04% in May from 8-year-high of 7.79% in April
237.article_body: India's retail inflation eased to 7.04% in the month of May, as compared to 7.79% in the previous month, data released by the government on Monday showed. This is the fifth consecutive month in which retail inflation has breached the RBI's upper margin of 6%. The CPI inflation of 7.79% recorded in April 2022 was the highest since May 2014.

238.title: B'luru hotel where Siddhanth detained for consuming drugs gets notice
238.article_body: The Bengaluru hotel where actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth Kapoor was detained during a police raid at a rave party has been given notice, police said. "We have asked specific questions, they will have to answer," said DCP East BS Guled. Siddhanth and five other persons have tested positive for drug usage, Bengaluru Police said.

239.title: Crypto market value slumps below $1 trillion for first time since Jan 2021
239.article_body: The value of cryptocurrency market on Monday fell below $1 trillion for the first time since January 2021, according to CoinMarketCap. The crypto market, which peaked at nearly $3 trillion in November 2021, has lost $1 trillion in value in the last two months alone. World's largest crypto Bitcoin was down over 10% on Monday, whereas Ethereum fell over 15%.

240.title: Lloyds Bank offers staff £1,000 to ease cost of living crisis: Report
240.article_body: Britain's Lloyds Bank on Monday told staff that it would give the vast majority of them a one-off £1,000 (about ₹95,000) payment to help combat the soaring cost of living, Reuters reported. The amount would reportedly be available in August and executives and senior managers have been exempted from the payout. The offer has been made to around 64,000 employees.

241.title: What's Google's LaMDA chatbot which allegedly 'behaved like a person'?
241.article_body: A senior Google engineer claimed that an AI chatbot developed by the tech giant gained sentience and was 'behaving like a person'. The LaMDA chatbot was first announced in 2021 and has the ability to have a "free-flowing" discussion on an "endless number of topics", as per Google. LaMDA can "unlock more natural ways of interacting with technology", said Google.

242.title: Was nervous before my IIFA 2022 performance; I danced after 6 yrs: Shahid
242.article_body: IIFA 2022's Instagram account shared a promo clip of the upcoming award telecast.  The video was of actor Shahid Kapoor before he performed at IIFA that took place in Abu Dhabi. In the video, he was heard saying, "I feel nervous, I'm dancing after 6 years." The actor also paid his tribute to the late music composer, Bappi Lahiri.

243.title: Hyderabad witnessed 10 days of heatwave in April this year: Report
243.article_body: Hyderabad witnessed 10 heatwave days (days when the temperature crosses 40°C) in April this year, a new report by Greenpeace has found. In 2021, the temperature had crossed the 40-degree mark only on one day, April 3, the report added. "Unbearable...heat is becoming the new normal in India as the effects of climate change become increasingly real,” the report stated.

244.title: Cong's Venugopal manhandled by police during protest march in Delhi
244.article_body: Congress leader KC Venugopal was manhandled by police when he, along with other Congress leaders, was marching towards the ED office in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi. In a video that surfaced on social media, the police can be seen taking away the Rajya Sabha MP. Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED in connection with the National Herald case.

245.title: Light rain expected in Delhi today, respite from heatwave likely from June 15
245.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD), while issuing a yellow alert for heatwave in Delhi on Monday, has predicted a cloudy sky with the possibility of light rain or drizzle later in the day. According to officials, a respite from the scorching heat is likely from June 15-16. Delhi's maximum temperature on Monday is likely to settle at 43 degrees Celsius.

246.title: 4 try to smuggle 150kg of beef, arrested by Noida Police
246.article_body: Noida Police arrested four men at the Delhi border for trying to smuggle 150kg of beef, officials said on Monday. Police arrested three accused on Sunday night from Sector 62 after a pick-up van was intercepted, leading to the discovery of beef. The fourth accused was arrested on Monday morning after a gunfight, said Additional DCP (Noida) Ran Vijay Singh.

247.title: Sanctions disrupting oil movement from Russia's Sakhalin-1: ONGC Videsh
247.article_body: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation's (ONGC) overseas investment arm ONGC Videsh is facing temporary disruptions in moving its share of oil from Russia's Sakhalin-1 project, MD Alok Gupta said. "This situation is going to be normalized over the next two-three weeks," Gupta added. Difficulties are arising in chartering ice-resistant tankers to ship oil as their operator Sovcomflot has been sanctioned.

248.title: Delhi's Kamla Nagar, Sarojini Nagar among 5 markets to be redeveloped
248.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said markets in the city will be redeveloped in terms of infrastructure. They will be branded in a phase-wise manner. The Delhi government will take five markets -- Kamla Nagar, Khari Baoli, Lajpat Nagar, Sarojini Nagar and Kirti Nagar -- in the first phase, the Chief Minister added.

249.title: 3 mothers file lawsuit over transgender lesson at a school in US
249.article_body: Three mothers have filed a lawsuit alleging that a teacher at a school in Mount Lebanon School District in US' Pennsylvania taught their first-grade children about transgender transition which violates school district policy and state law. The complainants claimed that the teacher had ignored their parental rights. The allegations are "untrue or based on partial truths," a spokesperson said.

250.title: Don't show ads promoting online betting: Govt as it issues advisory to media
250.article_body: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting on Monday issued an advisory to print, electronic and digital media to refrain from advertising online betting platforms. "Betting and gambling, illegal in most parts of the country, pose significant financial and socio-economic risk for the consumers, especially youth and children," the advisory stated. It added that online betting ads are misleading.

251.title: Kolkata Police summon Nupur Sharma over Prophet remark row
251.article_body: Kolkata Police has summoned ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for questioning in connection with her alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Sharma, who was suspended from BJP earlier this month, has been asked to appear at Narkeldanga Police Station on June 20 to record her statement, police said. TMC leader Abul Sohail has also lodged FIR against Sharma for her remarks.

252.title: Tarla Dalal's children complimented me for doing her role with conviction: Huma
252.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, who'll be essaying the role of India's first-ever home chef, Tarla Dalal, said the one thing she'll remember the most from the shoot is when Tarlaji's children visited her on the set. "They got emotional on seeing [parts of the film] and complimented me for doing the role with conviction. It was a surreal moment," she added.

253.title: Aditya's 'OM: The Battle Within' renamed to 'Rashtra Kavach OM': Report
253.article_body: Actor Aditya Roy Kapoor's upcoming action-thriller 'Om: The Battle Within' has been renamed to 'Rashtra Kavach OM', according to a report. "It seems that the film was facing trouble with regards to...title rights. Hence, the makers felt...it was better to change the title," Bollywood Hungama quoted a source as saying. The film is set to release on July 1.

254.title: Jennifer Hudson becomes an EGOT after Tony win for 'A Strange Loop'
254.article_body: Singer-actress Jennifer Hudson has become an EGOT (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, Tony) recipient after winning the 2022 Tony Award for co-producing 'A Strange Loop'. Jennifer previously won the Oscar for her role in the 2006 film 'Dreamgirls', two Grammys in 2009 and 2017 and a Daytime Emmy Award in 2021 for the animated short film 'Baba Yaga'.

255.title: Hopefully, this will prolong my career bit longer: Klaasen on his 81(46)
255.article_body: After scoring 81(46) against India on Sunday, South African batter Heinrich Klaasen has said that he hopes that the knock will "prolong" his career a "bit longer". "It was difficult (pitch) to bat. I found myself struggling up front. Then I decided if I go out today I would rather go my way and try to be positive," Klaasen said.

256.title: Good performances give you confidence: Imam-ul-Haq on 'Player of Series' win
256.article_body: Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq, who was named 'Player of the Series' in the side's 3-0 ODI series  whitewash against West Indies, said good performances give you confidence. "It feels very nice, I was working very hard on the process. It feels special," he added. Imam scored 65, 72 and 62 in the three ODIs in Multan.

257.title: 17-yr-old Hyd girl's gangrape pre-planned, accused boys were carrying condoms: Police
257.article_body: A Hyderabad police official has said that the 17-year-old girl's gangrape in Jubilee Hills was pre-planned. "The five accused, including four minors and one adult, committed the crime in a pre-planned manner. They even had condoms on them and used protection while committing the offence," the officer said. The accused reportedly underwent potency test on Saturday and Sunday.

258.title: Squad: Sunidhi shares throwback pics with Rahul Vaidya, Aditya Narayan
258.article_body: Singer Sunidhi Chauhan took to her Instagram handle to share throwback pictures with Aditya Narayan, Rahul Vaidya and Divya Kumar from 2004. "Squad," she captioned the post. Reacting to Sunidhi's post, Aditya wrote, "How good we look here." "Ohoo...Bestest picture," Divya commented, while Rahul Vaidya wrote, "Good times."

259.title: Australia pacer Kane Richardson ruled out of Sri Lanka ODIs
259.article_body: Australia fast bowler Kane Richardson has been replaced by pacer Scott Boland for the five-match ODI series against Sri Lanka. The 31-year-old suffered a "severe hamstring injury" during their third T20I against Sri Lanka on Saturday. Richardson was added to the ODI squad to cover for pacer Mitchell Starc, who had injured his bowling finger in the first T20I.

260.title: Would like to help this new young England batting side: Pietersen
260.article_body: Former England batter Kevin Pietersen has said that he would like to help the "new young England batting side". "I'd like to help them because I think what England need is a couple of coaches that are not scared to lose their job," Pietersen said. "Give youngsters that positive mindset on thinking outside of the box," he added.

261.title: Rahul will be exonerated from baseless accusations: Robert Vadra
261.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra’s husband Robert Vadra on Monday said Congress’ Rahul Gandhi will be undoubtedly exonerated from all "baseless" accusations. His statement came before Rahul arrived at ED’s office in Delhi today. "I believe, 'truth will prevail' and these harassments of the prevailing dispensation will not have the effect they desire," Vadra wrote in a Facebook post.

262.title: US’ Electric Last Mile to file for bankruptcy as shares lose 93% value
262.article_body: US-based electric truck startup Electric Last Mile Solutions (ELMS) said it plans to liquidate through a bankruptcy process, nearly one year after it was listed on Nasdaq and four months after both its CEO and Chairman resigned. ELMS' shares have fallen nearly 93% this year. ELMS said it's liquidating as the board found no better option for stakeholders and creditors.

263.title: 1 Taliban member killed, 6 injured in blast in Afghanistan's Kunar
263.article_body: One Taliban member was killed and six others, including one civilian, were injured in a blast in Afghanistan's Kunar on Sunday, reported TOLOnews. The incident occurred after a mine that was placed in an Islamic Emirate vehicle exploded, the report said. This comes after five Taliban members and a civilian were reportedly killed in an IED blast last week.

264.title: Chandigarh issues new advisory as COVID cases rise, people asked to wear masks
264.article_body: The Chandigarh administration on Monday issued a fresh advisory in view of the increasing number of COVID-19 cases. It asked people to always wear masks in public places and maintain social distance in public places. "All residents are hereby advised to get the booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine and get their children vaccinated too," the administration added.

265.title: Bengal Assembly passes bill to make CM Chancellor of state-run universities
265.article_body: The West Bengal Assembly on Monday passed a bill that sought to replace Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar with Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee as the Chancellor of all state-run universities. The West Bengal University Laws (Amendment) Bill was earlier passed by the state cabinet. State Education Minister Bratya Basu said there was ''nothing wrong'' with the CM taking over as the Chancellor.

266.title: Moosewala's songs played in NY's Times Square on his birthday, video surfaces
266.article_body: Late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was paid a tribute in New York's Times Square on his birthday on June 11. A video showing Moosewala's songs playing on Times Square billboards and his fans singing along to the songs has been widely shared online. Moosewala was shot dead by multiple gunmen in Punjab in May.

267.title: 9 lakh bank employees to go on strike on June 27 to demand 5-day work week
267.article_body: Nearly nine lakh bank employees will go on strike on June 27 to demand a five-day working week. "A five-day work week is a basic demand...and...for the betterment of health, and work-life balance of bank employees," the General Secretary of All Indian Bank Employees Association said. The strike will follow a weekend, leading to a straight three-day closure for banks.

268.title: Unsure about the severity of my abdomen issue: Andy Murray
268.article_body: Three-time Grand Slam champion Andy Murray has said that he is unsure about the severity of his abdomen issue which caused problems for him in the Stuttgart Open final on Sunday. "I got some pain in my abdomen when I was serving...Not something I've had before...Need to get it checked when I get home," the 35-year-old tennis player said.

269.title: Country needs double impact governance, not futile double engines: KTR
269.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said the country needs a "double impact governance", not "futile double engines". "Telangana with 2.5% of [the] Indian population contributes 5.0% to India’s GDP (Source: RBI report, October 2021)," KTR tweeted. Earlier on Saturday, KTR tweeted, "How many ED, IT and CBI raids on BJP leaders or their kith and kin in last eight years?"

270.title: HC dismisses plea for hate speech FIR against Anurag Thakur, Parvesh Singh
270.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday dismissed a plea seeking an FIR against Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh for alleged hate speeches during the anti-Citizenship Amendment Act protests in 2020. The plea was filed by CPI(M) leaders Brinda Karat and KM Tiwari. The HC, while dismissing the plea, said alternative remedies are available to the petitioner.

271.title: Sri Lankan official who said PM Modi 'pressured' to give power project to Adani quits
271.article_body: A senior Sri Lankan official who claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to the Adani Group has resigned. MMC Ferdinando, the former Chairman of Sri Lanka's Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), later withdrew his statement and President Rajapaksa issued an official statement "vehemently" denying the allegation.

272.title: See next ball to know what arrogance can do: Prasad to Twitter user over spat with Sohail
272.article_body: A Twitter user shared a picture from the 1996 spat between Venkatesh Prasad and Pakistan's Aamer Sohail and asked the former Indian pacer if he remembered it. Prasad responded, "He was arrogant in this image you posted, you need to see the next ball to know what arrogance can do...Uproot which in Hindi means Ukhaad."

273.title: Actors hike their fees after just 1 hit, this isn't good in long run: Bhushan
273.article_body: T-Series MD Bhushan Kumar has said that actors hike their fees after delivering just one successful film, adding that this practice is not good in the long run. "Actors should charge basis appeal of the film," he said. "Today, Aamir (Khan) sir signs a backend deal wherein he earns only if the film works," Bhushan further said.

274.title: BMC builds retaining wall along Poisar river in 15 days in Mumbai
274.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has built a retaining wall along the Poisar river in the Dahanukarwadi area in Mumbai. The construction of the retaining wall was completed in 15 days, BMC officials said. Earlier, the BMC had demolished nearly 30 shanties and huts that were obstructing the flow of the river.

275.title: Don't understand it, it's mind blowing: Graeme Smith on Axar batting ahead of Karthik
275.article_body: Talking about Axar Patel being sent to bat ahead of Dinesh Karthik in the second India-South Africa T20I, Graeme Smith said, "I don’t understand it." He added, "Karthik is one of the most experienced cricketers in India. Look at how many games he has played for India." Smith stated, "How can you send Axar ahead of him. This is mind-blowing."

276.title: Manchester City officially unveil their £51-million signing Erling Haaland, share pics
276.article_body: Manchester City on Monday officially unveiled their £51-million signing Erling Haaland from Borussia Dortmund. The 21-year-old has joined the club on a five-year deal. Haaland scored 86 goals in 89 matches during his two-and-a-half season stint at Dortmund. "This is a great move for me, and I can’t wait to get started in pre-season," Haaland said.

277.title: Root, Ollie Pope's fathers hug each other after sons' centuries vs NZ in 2nd Test
277.article_body: England batters Joe Root and Ollie Pope's fathers were seen hugging each other after their sons' centuries on Day 3 of the second Test against New Zealand. Pope scored 145 off 239 balls while Root remained unbeaten at 163 runs at the end of the third day. New Zealand had scored 553 runs in their first innings of the match.

278.title: Haddad Maia wins maiden WTA singles title after beating Alison Riske
278.article_body: Brazilian tennis player Beatriz Haddad Maia won her maiden WTA singles title after beating Alison Riske 6-4, 1-6, 6-3 in the Nottingham Open final. "It's an amazing week...couldn't expect a better start on grass," she stated. "I was...fighting, I was...pushing myself every single point, every single match," she added. Dan Evans defeated Jordan Thompson to win the men's event.

279.title: 3 killed including a 6-yr-old boy after jeep hits bike in Rajasthan
279.article_body: Three people on a motorbike were killed after their two-wheeler was hit by a speeding jeep near Karawada village in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district. Among the deceased was a 6-year-old boy identified as Rohit. The other two deceased were identified as Mohan (45) and his wife Kali (43). Notably, the accused left the spot leaving behind the vehicle, police said.

280.title: Rupee closes at a record low of 78.05 against US dollar for the 1st time
280.article_body: The Rupee closed at an all-time new low of 78.05 against the US dollar on Monday after breaching the 78-mark against the dollar for the first time amid elevated global oil prices and a sell-off in equity markets. On Friday, the Rupee closed at 77.93 per dollar, which was also an all-time low for the currency.

281.title: Loved The Family Man so much, signed web series with makers: Shahid
281.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has stated that he loved filmmaking duo Raj & DK's 'The Family Man 2'. He added, "They called me for a film, I asked if they had a show for me. They went, 'Really?' and I said, 'Yes!'" The actor further said he puts himself as an audience first and does projects that he would enjoy watching.

282.title: Russia may lose over 40,000 soldiers in June: Ukraine Prez
282.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russia will throw poorly trained conscripts into battle in a bid to outnumber Ukrainian troops. "But this only adds up to one thing - Russian losses in June might exceed 40,000 military personnel," he said. "They have not lost as many soldiers in any of the wars in many decades," he added.

283.title: 1,100 bullets worth ₹1.5 lakh seized from junk dealer's shop in Pune
283.article_body: Police have recovered over 1,100 bullets worth ₹1.56 lakh, most of them live, from the shop of a scrap dealer in Maharashtra's Pune, officials said on Sunday. A police official said that they received information that the accused had a large quantity of bullets, adding that a probe was on to ascertain from where he had sourced the bullets.

284.title: Over 200 people arrested for violence over Prophet remarks in Bengal
284.article_body: More than 200 people have been arrested and 42 cases have been lodged in connection with violence in West Bengal over BJP leaders' remarks against Prophet Muhammed, police said. DGP Manoj Malaviya said the situation is under control now. On Sunday, protesters had damaged a local train in Bethuadahari railway station in Nadia district.

285.title: Odisha man ties up 40-year-old son, leaves him to die under sun
285.article_body: A 65-year-old man tied up his unemployed 40-year-old son and left him to die under the sun in Odisha's Keonjhar, police said after the suspect was detained. The son died after a few hours. According to police, it seems the man wanted to punish his son for beating the latter's mother, following which she ended up with a fractured hip.

286.title: Attempt to protect ₹2,000 cr of Gandhi family: Irani on Cong protest march
286.article_body: Soon after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday reached ED's office in Delhi after a protest march by the party, Union Minister Smriti Irani said it was an attempt to allegedly protect Gandhi family's properties worth ₹2,000 crore. "Congress leaders have taken to the streets to pressurise an investigating agency openly because their corruption has been exposed," Irani added.

287.title: 18-year-old ends life by jumping into cousin's funeral pyre in MP
287.article_body: An 18-year-old man allegedly ended his life by jumping into the funeral pyre of his cousin sister in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district, police said on Monday. The man's 21-year-old cousin had allegedly died after slipping into a well. Some villagers pulled the man away and rushed him to a hospital but he died on the way.

288.title: Priyanka meets detained Congress leaders at Delhi police station
288.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Monday met with detained party leaders at Delhi's Tughlak Road police station. The Congress leaders were detained following their protests in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi, as he appeared before Enforcement Directorate in the National Herald case. Congress shared pictures of the meeting on its Twitter handle.

289.title: I'm really excited: Fatima on playing Indira Gandhi in Sam Bahadur
289.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh has begun preparations for her upcoming film 'Sam Bahadur'. The actress will be seen playing the role of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in the film. Speaking about it, Fatima said that she is very "excited". She added that she is studying thoroughly about Indira Gandhi by watching all her interviews and reading about her.

290.title: Our main aim is obviously the T20 WC in Australia: Shreyas Iyer
290.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has said the team's main aim is the upcoming T20 World Cup that will be played in Australia. "We have that sort of mindset where we're completely free and not thinking about anything else," he stated. "Even if we fail, we'll learn from that...and grow as a team...that's more important till we reach Australia," he added.

291.title: Bulldozer has become symbol of state-sponsored hooliganism: RLD chief
291.article_body: RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary said the use of a bulldozer is not the enforcement of the rule of law rather, it has become a symbol of state-sponsored "hooliganism". His statement came on Sunday when Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed’s property was demolished by the UP government. Javed was arrested on Saturday for his role in protests over Prophet remarks.

292.title: 2 police personnel injured in communal clash in Gujarat's Anand, 21 booked
292.article_body: As many as 21 persons have been booked for rioting and injuring two police personnel after two communities clashed in Borsad city of Gujarat's Anand following an altercation. Anand SP said the incident took place when police were trying to disperse the crowd and a mob from one of the communities started pelting stones at them.

293.title: Berrettini beats ex-world no. 1 Murray to win 1st title of 2022 in Stuttgart
293.article_body: World number 10 Matteo Berrettini won his first title of the season on Sunday after defeating ex-world number one Andy Murray 6-4, 5-7, 6-3 at Boss Open, Stuttgart. The 26-year-old Italian missed the clay season after undergoing a minor operation on his right hand in late March. "It's unbelievable. It was obviously a goal [to win the title]," said Berrettini.

294.title: Proud of my team: WI skipper Pooran after losing ODI series to Pak
294.article_body: Despite losing the ODI series to Pakistan by 3-0, West Indies limited-overs captain Nicholas Pooran has said that he is proud of his team. "We didn't get the results...but I am so proud of this team for sticking together through difficult periods and putting everything on the line for the people of the West Indies," Pooran said.

295.title: Assam Police nab 2 youths planning to join Naga separatist group
295.article_body: Assam Police apprehended two persons from the state's Sadiya district who were planning on joining Naga separatist outfit, NSCN-IM. The police, which received intelligence inputs, nabbed the youths and counselled them before handing them over to their respective families. "Youth can easily be influenced through social media. We are monitoring all activities," a police official said.

296.title: 'Drunk' bus driver loses control, vehicle overturns in Andhra; 5 dead
296.article_body: Five people, including a two-year-old baby, were killed and seven others were injured after a bus overturned in Andhra Pradesh's Sri Alluri Sitharamaraju district on Monday, police said. The accident occurred when the driver lost control of the bus while negotiating a turn. The bus passengers alleged that the driver was drunk and was driving in a rash manner.

297.title: 250 Cong workers detained in Mumbai for protesting in Rahul's support
297.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Monday detained over 250 Congress workers who took out a protest march in support of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi who was summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The workers marched from Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus to the ED office. Rahul appeared before the ED in connection with the National Herald case.

298.title: Macron's alliance edges ahead in 1st round of French elections
298.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron's alliance won the first round of parliamentary elections held on Sunday by a slim margin. While Macron's Ensemble alliance bagged 25.75% of the total votes, the rival bloc of NUPES led by Jean-Luc Melenchon secured 25.66%. The second and final round of elections will be held on June 19.

299.title: Video of Siddhanth from rave party surfaces after he gets detained for consuming drugs
299.article_body: A video of actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth Kapoor from rave party in a Bengaluru hotel has surfaced online after he was detained for consuming drugs. In the video, Siddhanth can be seen DJing at the venue. Another leaked clip showed police officials talking to the people after conducting a raid at the party.

300.title: Chhavi shares pic of scars from breast cancer surgery, says 'Will never remove them'
300.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture of her scars from breast cancer surgery. "Yesterday when I found the courage to flaunt this scar...there were some who flinched at the sight of it," she wrote. She added, "Some have also asked me if I’ll remove these scars with a laser or some such and I say never!"

301.title: We still haven't realised we're married: Ranbir on life with Alia after marriage
301.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor in an interview opened up about his life after marriage with Alia Bhatt and said that there have been no major changes in their lives. "The very next day of...marriage, we...left for work...We still haven't realised...we're married," he added. Ranbir further said they are thinking of taking a week off after the release of his film 'Shamshera'.

302.title: Bulldozers missing: Karti Chidambaram as Rahul appears before ED
302.article_body: Congress' Karti Chidambaram on Monday said he was "surprised" that BJP has only placed barricades and police leading to Congress office in Delhi, bulldozers were missing. "Guess all have been requisitioned to demolish lives and houses of citizens belonging to the minority faith," Chidambaram added. His statement came as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared before ED today after protest march.

303.title: Hyd man stuffs expired chemicals in manhole, dies as it explodes
303.article_body: A man in Hyderabad died after there was a blast in the sewerage manhole in which he dumped expired chemicals over time. Reports said that the man saw that the chemicals had not settled in the manhole. He then poured water on the chemicals, leading to a blast. His father was also injured in the incident.

304.title: Google engineer claims AI chatbot is 'behaving like a human', put on leave
304.article_body: A Google engineer, who claimed that a company's artificial intelligence-based chatbot had become "sentient" and was thinking and reasoning like a human being, has been placed on a paid leave. Google has also dismissed his claims. Blake Lemoine had published transcripts of his conversation with the LaMDA (Language Model for Dialogue Applications) chatbot and described it as "a person".

305.title: Sensex ends over 1,400 points lower, Nifty below 15,800 amid global selloff
305.article_body: The Sensex crashed 1,456 points to settle at 52,846 on Monday, whereas the Nifty closed 427 points lower at 15,774 amid global selloff. Bajaj twins, Tech Mahindra, IndusInd Bank and ICICI Bank were the top losers among S&P BSE Sensex companies, while Nestle India was the only gainer. The decline comes ahead of India's CPI inflation data on Monday evening.

306.title: Former British soldier killed fighting Russian forces in Ukraine
306.article_body: A former British soldier, Jordan Gatley, has been killed fighting for the Ukrainian armed forces in the city of Sievierodonetsk. Gatley had left the British Army in March and went to Ukraine to help in the fight against the Russian forces. Gatley's family said it had received the news on Friday that he had been shot and killed.

307.title: Bhuvneshwar knows selectors aren't considering him for Tests: Jaffer
307.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has praised Bhuvneshwar Kumar for his performance against South Africa in the second T20I on Sunday. "Bhuvneshwar is doing what he's famous for, making the ball swing...He knows selectors aren't considering him for Tests and he's playing just white-ball cricket," added Jaffer. Bhuvneshwar picked four wickets, conceding 13 runs in the game.

308.title: Ruturaj Gaikwad should be given one more opportunity: Sanjay Bangar
308.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar said Ruturaj Gaikwad should be given one more opportunity in the T20I series against South Africa. "The Indian team has...expectations from Ruturaj, they see him as a future top-order batter...his performance will...come under the microscope," he added. Sanjay said Ravi Bishnoi and Arshdeep Singh can replace Axar Patel and Avesh Khan in the third T20I.

309.title: Rahul leaves ED office after appearing in National Herald case
309.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi left the ED's office on June 13 after appearing in the National Herald money laundering case. Delhi Police detained several party leaders on Monday for staging protests against the Centre. Among those detained include Ashok Gehlot, Deepender Singh Hooda, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, KC Venugopal, Pawan Khera, Jairam Ramesh, Rajni Patil and Akhilesh Prasad Singh.

310.title: Most accidents resulting in deaths happen between 6pm & 9pm: Pune police
310.article_body: Most accidents in Pune in which deaths were reported happened between 6 pm and 9 pm, as per a study conducted by the Pune traffic branch. It added that the accidents in which serious injuries were reported happened between 9 am and 12 pm. The study was carried out from January to December 2021.

311.title: 'Major' actor Adivi meets Maha CM, calls it 'incredible moment'
311.article_body: Adivi Sesh, who was most recently seen in 'Major', met Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and described it as an incredible moment. Adivi, who has announced a fund in the name of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, wrote, "He (Uddhav Thackeray) promised to extend full support for our MAJOR promise fund for NDA aspirants." Adivi also thanked Mahesh Manjrekar for facilitating the meeting.

312.title: John Cena meets teen fan with Down Syndrome who fled Ukraine
312.article_body: Wrestler-actor John Cena recently flew down to meet a 19-year-old fan named Misha with Down Syndrome who fled Ukraine after his home was destroyed. Misha's mom motivated him to travel across Europe by telling him that they were going to meet Cena. In a video shared by WWE, Cena said, "Misha's story...reached out to me...story of Misha's mom as well."

313.title: Too much: Venkatesh Prasad on Nupur Sharma's effigy hanging outside mosque
313.article_body: Former cricketer Venkatesh Prasad has expressed concern over the hanging of suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's effigy outside a mosque in Karnataka amid protests against her comments on Prophet Muhammad. "I would urge everyone to leave politics aside and let sanity prevail. This is just too much," he tweeted. "Two wrongs don't make a right," Prasad further said.

314.title: I've no dreams like Alia to star in a H'wood film; I'm happy where I am: Ranbir
314.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor spoke about his plans of starring in a Hollywood film. He revealed he has no dreams of Hollywood. "I only have dreams of Brahmastra. I think original content that is in your culture...can touch every audience," he said. "I've never seen the success and dreams of Alia (wife) in anyone else. I'm happy where I'm," he added.

315.title: K'taka Guv, CM receive President Kovind on his arrival in B'luru
315.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind has arrived in Karnataka's Bengaluru for his two-day visit. He was received by the state Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot and CM Basavaraj Bommai on his arrival. The President will be attending the Platinum Jubilee Celebrations of Rashtriya Military School today, while tomorrow he will attend the Lokarpana ceremony of ISKCON's Sri Rajadhiraja Govinda Temple.

316.title: West Bengal extends summer vacations till June 26 due to ‘extreme heatwave’
316.article_body: The West Bengal government has extended the summer vacations in the state till June 26. "With regard to declaring summer vacations in the schools due to extreme heatwave conditions, as reports of a few death cases due to heat and humidity have been received, the competent authority has decided to extend the summer vacations," the government release said.

317.title: Selectively highlighting arrest of individual: Luv on Siddhanth's arrest
317.article_body: Shatrughan Sinha's son Luv Sinha has reacted to the arrest of Shakti Kapoor's son Siddhanth Kapoor for consuming drugs. He tweeted, "Selectively highlighting the arrest...seems like an effort to show that [officials] are doing their job instead of actually doing it." Luv added, "Arrest the producers...not just the users...I hope my friend [Siddhanth] comes out of this stronger and wiser."

318.title: Man dies in police custody, 2nd custodial death in Chennai in 2 months
318.article_body: A history-sheeter died allegedly in police custody in Chennai on Sunday. This was the second such instance in Chennai in two months. Notably, the deceased, identified as Rajasekar, was taken into custody in connection with an investigation. Later, he was taken to a private hospital after he complained of feeling unwell, where he was declared brought dead, police said.

319.title: Driver rapes married woman in his bus in Pune, arrested
319.article_body: A 38-year-old driver of a private tourist bus has been arrested for allegedly raping a 21-year-old woman in his vehicle in Pune, police said. The victim, who is from Maharashtra's Washim district, came to Pune along with her husband a few days ago in search of a job. The couple worked as labourers, the police added.

320.title: Loan recovery agents threaten to invite Mumbai man's contacts to his funeral
320.article_body: A 37-year old man from Mumbai has claimed that loan recovery agents allegedly threatened to call each person in his contact list and invite them to his funeral if he didn't repay them. The agents allegedly said they would tell the man's contacts that he had passed away. The accused also allegedly shared with the victim his obscene morphed image.

321.title: India lose 2-3 to Belgium at FIH Men's Pro Hockey League
321.article_body: India lost to Belgium 2-3 in the second leg of their FIH Men's Pro Hockey League tie in Antwerp, Belgium, on Sunday. Following the loss, India dropped down to third from second in the standings, with 29 points from 14 matches. India will now play against table-toppers Netherlands on June 18 and 19 in Rotterdam.

322.title: Mobile point-of-sale app QueueBuster raises ₹63 cr in Series A round
322.article_body: Noida-based mobile point-of-sale application QueueBuster on Monday raised ₹63.3 crore in a Series A funding round led by Chiratae Ventures, Omidyar Network India and Flourish Ventures. The application can be used to manage billing, inventory, customers and loyalty programmes for all forms of businesses. The startup was founded in 2016 by a team of second-time entrepreneurs led by Varun Tangri.

323.title: No one better to do it: Chris on Mackie becoming Captain America
323.article_body: Actor Chris Evans said he's proud of actor Anthony Mackie for becoming the new Captain America in the MCU. "No one better to do it....he honestly does it justice," Chris stated. "I can't wait to see what they do in the future with it, but if there's any tear shed, it's just for the sweet memories I had," he added.

324.title: Chiranjeevi voices Brahmastra's Telugu trailer; Ayan touches his feet
324.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi will also be a part of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer Brahmastra. The veteran Telugu actor came on board to lend his voice for the Telugu version of director Ayan Mukerji's Brahmastra trailer. In a behind-the-scenes video shared by Ayan, Chiranjeevi is seen recording his portion for the trailer, meanwhile, Ayan welcomed the actor by touching his feet.

325.title: Inclination might be towards Umran for the next match vs SA: Zaheer
325.article_body: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan has said Team India might include pacer Umran Malik in the playing XI for their next match against South Africa in the ongoing T20I series. "Extra pace can be handy...I'm expecting...one change purely because the ground [for the third T20I] is small," he added. Umran is yet to make his debut for Team India.

326.title: Will take U'khand forward: CM after taking oath as Champawat MLA
326.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who took oath as Champawat's MLA on Monday, thanked PM Narendra Modi and other BJP leaders for giving "the son of a soldier" the opportunity to lead the state. Dhami added that he'll work towards Uttarakhand's progress and make it one of India's best states. He won by over 55,000 votes in state Assembly bypolls.

327.title: Munawar Faruqui refers to Bieber's facial paralysis in his political joke, criticised
327.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui has been criticised after he referred to Justin Bieber's facial paralysis in a political joke. "Dear Justin Bieber, I can totally understand. Even here in India right side [is] not working properly," Faruqui wrote. "You think making a joke about somebody’s illness is funny?" a comment read. "Don’t use someone else’s pain...in...name of comedy," another user wrote.

328.title: 'Abnormal' dinosaur egg fossil discovered in MP, pics released
328.article_body: Delhi University researchers have found an unusual fossilised egg of a titanosaurid dinosaur in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, pictures of which have been released in the Scientific Reports journal. This is the first time scientists have come across the "abnormal" and rare 'egg-within-an-egg' or 'ovum-in-ovo' phenomenon in dinosaurs. It's been known to occur only in birds until now.

329.title: Ramped up medical supplies amid COVID-19, WTO couldn't respond with alacrity: India
329.article_body: India ramped up its supplies of medical products to different countries to deal with the COVID-19 pandemic, but the World Trade Organisation (WTO) could not react with alacrity, said Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal. He added, "The rich countries need to introspect. We need to bow our heads in shame for our inability to respond to the pandemic in time."

330.title: Will build counter-strike capabilities: Japan PM after admitting issues with China
330.article_body: Speaking at the Shangri-La Dialogue, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said, "I am determined to fundamentally reinforce Japan's defence capabilities...In doing so we will not rule out any options, including the so-called counter-strike capabilities." PM Kishida admitted that issues exist between Japan and China due to being neighbouring countries and called on China to "act responsibly".

331.title: India should persist with Ishan even when Rohit, Rahul return: Gambhir
331.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said Team India should persist with opener Ishan Kishan in the playing XI even when Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli return to the team. "Whether Ishan scores runs or not, he brings in that fearless approach," stated Gambhir. Ishan has scored 76 and 34 runs in the two T20Is against South Africa.

332.title: UP govt creating an atmosphere of terror by bulldozing homes: Mayawati
332.article_body: BSP President Mayawati has criticised the Uttar Pradesh Government for demolishing the homes of protestors, especially from the Muslim community, using bulldozers. "By targeting a particular community, by bulldozing their homes...the state government is suppressing the citizen's right to protest and creating an atmosphere of fear and terror, which is unfair and unjust," Mayawati tweeted.

333.title: VHP passes resolution for implementation of Uniform Civil Code
333.article_body: The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Sunday passed a resolution calling for the implementation of a Uniform Civil Code in the country. "For the resolution of various problems in the country, it is imperative to implement one law for every section of the society," said religious leader Swami Avdheshanand Giri Maharaj at the meeting held in Haridwar.

334.title: Extended ITO skywalk to connect Delhi's Pragati Maidan metro station & SC
334.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) is planning to add an arm to the existing ITO skywalk by constructing a foot-overbridge to provide direct connectivity between the Supreme Court and Pragati Maidan metro station. The department has floated tenders for the overbridge's construction at an estimated cost of ₹9.3 crore. The tendering process will be completed by this month-end, officials said.

335.title: 4 policemen host booze party at traffic police outpost in Guj; held
335.article_body: Four police officers, including an assistant sub-inspector, were arrested on Sunday for hosting a booze party at a traffic police outpost in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The accused police officers were arrested after they were allegedly found in an inebriated state, as per the police. A police team had raided the outpost after a video of the party surfaced online.

336.title: Dad being framed, he's been cooperative: UP violence accused's daughter
336.article_body: Sumaiya Fatima, daughter of Javed Mohammad, who is an accused in the violence that erupted in Uttar Pradesh following remarks made about Prophet by a former BJP leader, said that her father is being framed. "He has always been cooperative with the administration and has never been named in anything illegal," Fatima added

337.title: Director convinced my dad overnight: Shilpa on her 1st film offer
337.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty revealed director Dilip Naik had offered a film to her when she was 17 while she had gone for a screen test for an ad. Shilpa added she told Dilip that her father will not allow her to act. "He visited our house...convinced my dad overnight that I was a perfect fit for his film," she stated.

338.title: Akshay used to wake up at 4:30, 7 am shift was cakewalk for him: Co-star Deepak
338.article_body: Deepak Tijori, while recalling working with Akshay Kumar in the film 'Khiladi', said that Akshay used to wake up at 4:30 am. "For him, 7:00 am shift was a cakewalk...Meanwhile, I'd to die a million deaths to reach the sets at 7:00 am," he added. Deepak further said Akshay was very disciplined as he was into fitness and martial arts.

339.title: Investors lose ₹7 lakh crore wealth as Sensex crashes over 1,600 points
339.article_body: Nearly ₹7 lakh crore was wiped out of the investors' wealth on Monday as the Sensex crashed more than 1,600 points in afternoon trade. Indian shares fell sharply amid a global selloff in the equities market. The selloff was triggered after US inflation hit a 40-year-high of 8.6% in May. Indian rupee hit record low of 78 per US dollar.

340.title: Rekha in talks to join Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi': Report
340.article_body: Veteran actress Rekha is reportedly in advanced talks with Sanjay Leela Bhansali for a pivotal role in his web series 'Heeramandi'. "Rekha has been keen to work with Bhansali for the longest time and he too is desirous of tapping into 'the Rekha mystique'," a source told Bollywood Hungama. 'Heeramandi' will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹200 crore.

341.title: If he plays big knock, Ruturaj can be in India's T20 WC squad: Jaffer
341.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said opener Ruturaj Gaikwad played an "attractive" knock in Delhi in the first T20I against South Africa. "I see him getting opportunities in the future...because there's no third opener in this team. No replacement has been made [for KL Rahul]," he added. "If he plays...big innings, he can...be a candidate [for India's T20 World Cup squad]," he stated.

342.title: Shane Warne recognised posthumously in Queen's birthday honours
342.article_body: Shane Warne has been recognised posthumously in this year's Queen’s birthday honours list. He was honoured for his distinguished service to cricket as a player, role model and commentator, to the community through charitable initiatives, and for philanthropic contributions. Warne was honoured as Officer of the Order of Australia.

343.title: Wife fell silent after film screening, asked 'Should you do such films': Rajpal
343.article_body: Actor Rajpal Yadav said his wife fell silent after screening of one of his films. "I asked her 'Is everything okay?'...and her response was...'Should you do such kind of films?' She didn't like the film or my role," Yadav said. He added he does not feel happy on being called comedian because he feels he's been put into small category.

344.title: Ludhiana govt school teacher booked for stalking girl students
344.article_body: A government school teacher was booked by the Ludhiana Rural Police for allegedly stalking girl students and sending them inappropriate messages on phone. The matter came to light after some students filed a written complaint with the principal. They accused him of calling them at night and forcing them to talk to him. An FIR was registered in the matter.

345.title: Mumbai man's morphed images circulated despite paying double loan amount
345.article_body: A 39-year-old Mumbai resident's morphed images were circulated by fraudsters despite the former paying double the loan amount, which was allegedly given to him without his will. After continuous threats and a morphed image shared with the complainant's relatives, where he is accused of raping a 15-year-old girl, the victim filed a complaint at the Meghwadi Police Station.

346.title: Do something productive: Virat's brother to troll comparing their Instagram followers
346.article_body: Virat Kohli's brother Vikas Kohli responded to a troll who mocked him by comparing his Instagram followers with that of Virat's. The troll remarked that Virat has crossed 200 million followers, while Vikas doesn't even have 1 million followers. "Kid, do something productive...Don't give unnecessary advice here," Vikas responded.

347.title: Google to pay $118 mn to over 15,000 female staff to settle gender pay bias lawsuit
347.article_body: Google has agreed to pay $118 million to over 15,000 female employees to settle a class-action gender discrimination lawsuit. The lawsuit first emerged in 2017 after three women in the US filed a complaint accusing Google of paying its female employees $17,000 a year less than male staff doing the same job. They were originally seeking $600 million in damages.

348.title: Electrical transformer falls as car hits pole in Rajasthan, man burnt alive
