348.article_body: A man was burnt alive in Rajasthan's Nagaur district on Sunday when the car in which he was travelling hit a power pole, causing an electrical transformer to fall on the vehicle. Police said a fire was ignited after the fall. Police added that the other occupants of the car managed to escape but the deceased was trapped inside.

349.title: Cong leaders including Gehlot, Adhir Ranjan detained for protesting in Delhi
349.article_body: Congress leaders including Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury were detained after they participated in protest march held by the party on Monday. Party leaders Rajni Patil, Akhilesh Prasad Singh, L Hanumanthaiah and Su Thirunavukkarasar were also detained. Meanwhile, Chowdhury has written to SHO Tughlaq Road alleging manhandling by Delhi Police on way to ED office.

350.title: No tactical sense: Zelenskyy on Russian strike that injured 22
350.article_body: Following a Russian strike in Ternopil's Chortkiv, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Sunday that the strike had "no tactical or strategic sense...as in the vast majority of other Russian strikes." The region's Governor Volodymyr Trush had stated that 22 people were injured in the strike. "Ten people are still in hospitals...This is terror, just terror," Zelenskyy added.

351.title: Person says 'can't enter house' due to parked truck; B'luru police remove it
351.article_body: Following a person's complaint about a cargo truck being parked in front of their house's gate, Bengaluru's Chickpete Traffic police on Monday said that the vehicle has been removed. The person had earlier tweeted that they had filed multiple complaints with the Chickpete traffic police but no action was taken. "We cannot enter our house," the person had said.

352.title: Stop witch-hunt of Muslims: JNUSU protests demolition of activist's house
352.article_body: The Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) on Sunday protested against the demolition of activist and former JNU student Afreen Fatima's house in UP's Prayagraj. Terming CM Yogi Adityanath's administration as "bulldozer raj", the members held placards saying, "Stop the witch-hunt of Muslims." Fatima's father, Mohammad Javed has been arrested over the recent violence in Prayagraj.

353.title: Congress is doing 'Jashn-e-Bhrashtachar': BJP's Sambit Patra
353.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra said what Congress is doing today is 'Jashn-e-Bhrashtachar'- celebrating corruption. His statement came as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED in Delhi. "Congress has yet again tried launching Rahul Gandhi module from the pad of corruption, we assure that he'll meet the same fate, he will fail yet again," Patra added.

354.title: When the match gets tight, Rishabh Pant panics: Wasim Jaffer
354.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said stand-in captain Rishabh Pant "panics a bit" when the match "gets tight". Jaffer added, "We saw something similar in the IPL as well. I feel the more he captains, the better he'll get." Under Pant, India have lost two games in a row against South Africa in the five-match T20I series.

355.title: Efforts made to suppress voices of different ideologies: Sachin Pilot
355.article_body: After permission was denied to the Congress to hold a Satyagraha march in Delhi, party leader Sachin Pilot has accused BJP of suppressing "the voice of people of different ideologies". "People are seeing the way BJP is misusing the central agencies. Cases, which were already closed 7-8 years ago, have been filed against Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi," Pilot said.

356.title: Got a call from 9-yr-old who wants to join Army: Adivi on success of Major
356.article_body: Adivi Sesh, speaking about the success of the Hindi version of his film 'Major', said, "We were underdog in Hindi, suddenly we'd showtime all over." "I'm getting calls from...everywhere. I got a call from...9-year-old who wants to join...Army after watching...Hindi version, not Telugu," he added. 'Major' is based on Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, who was martyred in 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

357.title: Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram' collects ₹300 cr globally in 10 days
357.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' has earned over ₹300 crore globally within 10 days of its release, according to film trade analyst Ramesh Bala. "At the end of the second weekend, 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹300 cr...mark at the worldwide box office," Ramesh tweeted. The film collected ₹210 crore across India after collecting ₹46 crore in the second weekend.

358.title: If Chahal thinks 'I'll bowl tight, get wickets', it's not happening: Gambhir
358.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir questioned Yuzvendra Chahal's bowling approach in the second T20I against South Africa, stating that the spinner didn't vary his pace in the game. "If Chahal thinks 'I'll bowl tight and get wickets', it's not going to happen...Chahal needs to have an attacking mindset," added Gambhir. Chahal picked one wicket, conceding 49 runs in the second T20I.

359.title: Fire guts hundreds of vehicles in tow yard in Pakistan's Karachi
359.article_body: A fire broke out in a tow yard in Pakistan's Karachi on Sunday, gutting more than 440 impounded vehicles, including cars and motorbikes. According to officials, fire tenders reached the spot within 15 minutes and the blaze was brought under control in three hours. The police ruled out the possibility of sabotage in the preliminary investigation.

360.title: Amazon ordered to pay ₹200 cr penalty in 45 days after plea against CCI rejected
360.article_body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Monday rejected Amazon's plea challenging the CCI's decision to suspend the approval for the e-commerce company's deal with Future Coupons. It directed Amazon to pay the penalty of ₹200 crore imposed by CCI within 45 days from Monday. Future Coupons Pvt Ltd (FCPL) is a promoter of Future Retail Ltd (FRL).

361.title: Canada criticises its official's visit to Russian embassy for event
361.article_body: Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly on Sunday called a visit by the country's official to the Russian embassy in Ottawa "unacceptable". "No Canadian representative should have attended the event hosted at the Russian embassy and no Canadian representative will attend this kind of event again," she said. She also reiterated Canada's support for Ukraine amid Russia's "egregious invasion".

362.title: CID actor Hrishikesh robbed of cash, documents while travelling on AC bus in Mumbai
362.article_body: CID actor Hrishikesh Pandey was recently robbed of cash, credit cards and other documents while travelling on an AC bus in Mumbai. "Since I've played a CID Inspector, it became a joke how in the show people come to us with cases and we solve them," he said. "I'm hoping that the police department will crack this case," he added.

363.title: Joe Root smashed 10 Test hundreds in last 17 months; Kohli, Smith and Williamson 0
363.article_body: England's Joe Root has smashed 10 Test hundreds in the last 17 months, while Virat Kohli, Steve Smith and Kane Williamson haven't been able to hit a single Test hundred in the time period. Since January 13, 2021, Root has scored 2,355 runs in 42 innings. Meanwhile, Kohli has scored 725 runs in 24 innings, including five fifties.

364.title: Wayne Parnell's 'heart' celebration after Pandya's wicket goes viral
364.article_body: South Africa fast bowler Wayne Parnell's celebration after Hardik Pandya's dismissal in the second T20I in Cuttack has gone viral. Parnell was seen making a 'heart' gesture with his hands after bowling Pandya out for nine runs off 12 deliveries. South Africa defeated India by four wickets to take a 2-0 series lead.

365.title: Patanjali unit withdraws ads on ayurvedic products after complaint by doctor
365.article_body: Kozhikode Divya Pharmacy, attached to Patanjali Ayurved, has withdrawn advertisements of its Ayurvedic products after Kerala-based Dr KV Babu lodged a complaint against ads claiming to cure diabetes, heart and liver diseases. The AYUSH ministry also said it found the ads to be "objectionable and misleading" under provisions of the Drugs and Magic Remedies (Objectionable Advertisements) Act, 1954.

366.title: Israeli trekker goes missing in Himachal Pradesh, search underway
366.article_body: An Israeli trekker has gone missing at Hampta Pass Trek between the Kullu and Lahaul-Spiti districts of Himachal Pradesh. Two Israeli trekkers, identified as Yuvan Cohan and Ran, were completing the trek but one of them, Ran, hasn't reached the Koksar area yet, said an official.

367.title: Pfizer COVID-19 vaccines safe, effective for kids under 5: US FDA
367.article_body: The Food and Drug Administration of the US has said that Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccines appear to be safe and effective for children aged under five. The FDA released its analysis ahead of a meeting scheduled for Wednesday in which outside experts will vote to determine if the vaccine should be approved for children in that age group.

368.title: Denied phone to wish mom on b'day, 14-yr-old boy kills self in B'luru hostel
368.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died by suicide after he was allegedly not provided with a mobile phone by the hostel warden to wish his mother on her birthday in Bengaluru. Reports said that he was not allowed to speak to his family members when they tried contacting him several times. Other students in the hostel reportedly found the boy dead.

369.title: Dad said 'He's singing like shopkeeper': Kishore's son recalls his 1st recording
369.article_body: Singer Amit Kumar, son of Kishore Kumar, recalled his first song recording and said, "He (Kishore) was sitting...with Raj Kapoor." "Dad's attention was both ways, whatever I was singing and whatever Raj ji was telling him," Amit said, adding, "He suddenly told RD Burman 'He's singing like some shopkeeper, he's singing weirdly'...I told him 'why don't you leave'...And they...sweetly left."

370.title: Didn't require someone to start hitting: Iyer on Axar batting ahead of Karthik
370.article_body: Explaining India's decision to send Axar Patel ahead of Dinesh Karthik in the second T20I against South Africa, Shreyas Iyer said they needed someone to rotate strike after they were 90/4 in 12.4 overs. "DK can also do that, but he's been a really good asset for us after 15 overs, where he can straightaway slog the ball," Shreyas added.

371.title: Islam says Nupur Sharma should be forgiven: Jamaat Ulama-e-Hind
371.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma, Jamaat Ulama-e-Hind's Suhaib Qasmi said she should be forgiven as per Islam. He added, "Islam says Nupur Sharma should be forgiven. We disagree with the protest that started across the country after Friday prayers against Nupur Sharma and her derogatory remarks."

372.title: We congratulate India for action against those who spoke against Prophet: Bangladesh
372.article_body: Speaking on the controversy over remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Bangladesh information minister Hasan Mahmud said, "We congratulate the Government of India [for taking] legal action against those who said [something] against Prophet Muhammad." He added, "This is an external issue...This is an issue of India and I don't think that we have to say many things about this."

373.title: Bitcoin drops 9% to fall below $25,000 level, its lowest since Dec 2020
373.article_body: Bitcoin dropped as much as 8.9% to $24,903.49, its lowest since December 2020 on Monday. Bitcoin is down more than 43% so far this year (YTD), and is trading far below its record high of $69,000 it had hit in November last year. Meanwhile, Ether dropped more than 8% to $1,303, its lowest since March 2021.

374.title: Bhuvneshwar will be a huge plus for India in T20 WC in Aus: Gavaskar
374.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Bhuvneshwar Kumar was "brilliant" against South Africa in the second T20I. "The white ball doesn't swing that much, in the air or off the surface...he has got that capability," he stated. "To have...him in Australia [for T20 World Cup], where there will [be]...little bit of more carry and bounce...that'll be a huge plus," Gavaskar concluded.

375.title: Hope you fly even higher this year: Tiger on Disha Patani's b'day
375.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, Tiger Shroff shared a video with his rumoured girlfriend Disha Patani to wish the actress on her birthday. In the video, Tiger and Disha can be seen running towards the mat and jumping high up in the air. Along with the video, Tiger wrote, "Hope you fly even higher this year happy birthday action hero!"

376.title: 21 booked for hurling casteist slurs during Dalit groom's procession in Raj
376.article_body: The police have booked 21 people for allegedly hurling casteist slurs and creating ruckus during a Dalit groom's pre-wedding procession in Rajasthan's Kota. The DSP said that "some people belonging to the upper castes, who were apparently drunk", had done so when the procession passed through their locality. Four police personnel were already deployed with the procession, the DSP added.

377.title: Rahul reaches ED office to appear in National Herald case after protest march
377.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday reached the office of Enforcement Directorate for questioning in the National Herald money laundering case. He reached the ED office after protest march by the Congress. News agency ANI reported that he was surrounded by hundreds of party workers. Party workers had earlier gathered at party headquarters to express solidarity with top leadership.

378.title: Mumbai city sinking on an average of 2mm every year: Study
378.article_body: A recent research has found Mumbai to be sinking at an average rate of 2mm annually. The study claims a geological phenomenon known as land subsidence behind this and warns of increased flooding in the city. The study, which analysed land subsidence in 99 coastal cities globally between 2015-2020, found China's Tianjin to be the fastest sinking city globally (5.2cm/year).

379.title: Crypto firm Celsius pauses all transfers, withdrawals citing 'extreme market conditions'
379.article_body: Cryptocurrency lending firm Celsius Network has paused all withdrawals and transfers between accounts due to "extreme market conditions", the company said on Monday. "We're taking this necessary action...in order to stabilise liquidity and operations while we take steps to preserve and protect assets," it added. Notably, Bitcoin tumbled as much as 7% to $25,366, at an 18-month low on Monday.

380.title: Man starts 'first' donkey farm in K'taka, receives orders worth ₹17 lakh for donkey milk
380.article_body: Srinivas Gowda, a 42-year-old native of Ramanagara, has started the 'first' donkey farm in Karnataka after quitting his job in a software company. The farm will have 20 donkeys to start with, Gowda said. Srinivas said that he will sell donkey's milk to be used for beauty products, adding that he has already received orders worth ₹17 lakh.

381.title: You could feel India's drive going down in 2nd T20I vs SA: Zaheer
381.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said he could feel India's "drive" going down during Heinrich Klaasen and Temba Bavuma's fourth-wicket partnership in the second T20I. "It was evident on the field...[This] is the thing Rahul Dravid and Co. need to address," Zaheer added. Klaasen and Bavuma added 64 runs, helping SA to chase down India's 149-run target in 18.2 overs.

382.title: LIC shares decline by 3.2%, hit a record low at ₹681.71
382.article_body: LIC shares hit a new record low as the lock-in period for anchor investors in the country's largest IPO ended today. While the stock opened at ₹691 a share, it touched a fresh all-time low of ₹681.71 on the BSE intraday, 3.2% down from its previous close. Notably, this was the tenth consecutive session when the stock was trading lower.

383.title: Varun hugs a specially-abled fan, poses with him for pics; video surfaces
383.article_body: A video shared by photographer Viral Bhayani shows actor Varun Dhawan posing with a specially-abled fan for pictures. In the video, the fan can also be seen hugging Varun and giving a peck on his cheek. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Varun is one of the kindest actors in Bollywood," while another fan wrote, "This made my day."

384.title: Russia blows up bridge linking Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk city
384.article_body: The Russian forces blew up a bridge connecting Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk to another city across the river, said local officials on Sunday. This has cut off a possible route for evacuation of civilians, they added. "About 500 civilians remain on the territory of the Azot plant in Sievierodonetsk, 40 of them are children," said Luhansk Governor Serhiy Gaidai.

385.title: Man loses control of 2-wheeler, hits 2 women; Cyberabad Police retweet video
385.article_body: The Cyberabad Police retweeted a video, shared by the Medak District Police, of a man driving a two-wheeler. The man can be seen losing control of the vehicle and hitting two women who were walking on the side of the road. Towards the end of the video, the man can be seen lying on the road after the accident.

386.title: Satyendar Jain sent to 14-day judicial custody in alleged money laundering case
386.article_body: The Rouse Avenue court in Delhi on Monday sent AAP leader and Delhi minister Satyendar Jain to 14-day judicial custody in an alleged money laundering case. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate said it recovered ₹2.85 crore in cash and 133 gold coins after conducting raids on Jain and his associates. Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on May 30.

387.title: Undeclared emergency in Delhi: Surjewala ahead of Rahul's ED appearance
387.article_body: Ahead of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s appearance before the ED in Delhi on Monday, party leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said "coward" PM Narendra Modi-led government has imposed an undeclared emergency in Central Delhi. "The coward Modi government has deployed many police barriers and police personnel…This proves that the Modi government is shaken by Congress," Surjewala added.

388.title: Over 4,000 International Driving Permits issued to Delhi residents since Feb
388.article_body: The Delhi transport department has issued 4,286 International Driving Permits (IDP) from February till June 7, 2022. According to the data, 1,150 were given for the United States and 986 were given for Canada in 2022, followed by Great Britain (442) and the UAE (335). Notably, 439 IDPs were issued in June to residents of Delhi who had moved abroad.

389.title: Twitter user posts video of man stealing scooter in Hyd, tags police
389.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video of a man stealing a scooter from a street in Hyderabad. While tagging Hyderabad Police, the user wrote, "Sir, One Activa bike...was stolen from Shahalibanda new road...on 12th June under...@shohussainialam...kindly put some special teams to recover this bike as soon as possible as till now no FIR has been issued."

390.title: Mr Bean was self-centred, narcissistic anarchist: Rowan Atkinson
390.article_body: British actor Rowan Atkinson, speaking about his character Mr Bean, has said that the character was a "self-centred, narcissistic anarchist". Rowan will be playing Trevor in his upcoming series 'Man Vs Bee'. While comparing Trevor to Mr Bean, Rowan said, "Trevor is different. He is a much nicer and much sweeter and more normal person."

391.title: BJP's cronyism has crossed Palk Strait: Rahul on power project claim
391.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said BJP’s "cronyism" has crossed Palk Strait and moved into Sri Lanka. His statement came after a top Sri Lankan official claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to billionaire Gautam Adani’s Adani Group. The official later retracted the claims.

392.title: Pune residents with no pipeline gas connections get bills: Report
392.article_body: Some residents in Pune's Akurdi, Baner and Aundh have recently received pipeline gas bills despite them not having Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) connections, reported Hindustan Times. "We received a bill of ₹2,697. I've sent a complaint to MNGL but there is no response," a resident said. "It doesn't happen frequently...we resolve the issue immediately," MNGL MD Deepak Sawant said.

393.title: I love working with Saif, I find him very funny: Vikram Vedha co-star Radhika
393.article_body: Sharing her experience of working with Saif Ali Khan in 'Vikram Vedha', actress Radhika Apte said that she loves working with him, adding that she finds him very funny. "I'm only laughing on the sets," she added. Radhika has previously worked with Saif in 'Sacred Games' and 'Baazaar'. Radhika further said she had a great time working with Hrithik Roshan.

394.title: Man kills father, runs over 4 cyclists, jumps into river in Germany
394.article_body: A 37-year-old man killed his father and ran over four cyclists while trying to escape the scene in Germany's Mannheim city on Sunday, said police. The suspect then left his damaged vehicle, fled on foot and jumped into the Rhine river, added police. One of the cyclists, a 71-year-old woman, was killed, while the others were taken to hospitals.

395.title: Klaasen targeted spinners well, his execution was very good: Shreyas
395.article_body: Shreyas Iyer, speaking about South Africa batter Heinrich Klaasen's knock in the second T20I, has said, "Klaasen targeted our spinners...well. He played shots off good lengths." Klaasen scored 46-ball 81 runs to help South Africa beat India by four wickets in the second T20I. "I don't think our bowlers did much wrong...It was just...Klaasen's execution was very good," Shreyas stated.

396.title: Delhi districts asked to increase COVID tests; enforce masks: Officials
396.article_body: Amid a rise in the number of COVID-19 cases being reported daily, the Delhi government has asked the district administrations to restart random testing at public places, officials quoted by Hindustan Times, said. The districts have also been asked to increase the number of booster vaccinations and focus on enforcing measures like masking and social distancing, reports said.

397.title: It's not possible: Shakti Kapoor after son Siddhanth gets detained for consuming drugs
397.article_body: After his son Siddhanth Kapoor was detained for consuming drugs at a rave party in a Bengaluru hotel, actor Shakti Kapoor said, "I can only say one thing...it's not possible." Siddhanth was taken to Ulsoor Police Station after he tested positive for drug usage. As per police, five other people at the party also tested positive for drug usage.

398.title: Kuwait to deport expats over protest against Nupur Sharma's Prophet remarks
398.article_body: Kuwait will be deporting expats who took part in a demonstration against the remarks made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on Prophet Muhammad after Friday prayers. The protesters violated the laws and regulations of the country which stipulate that sit-ins or demonstrations by expats are not to be organised in Kuwait. They will be banned from entering Kuwait again.

399.title: Pune ATM machine catches fire as thieves try to cut it open, ₹3.98 lakh burnt
399.article_body: According to police, ₹3.98 lakh cash was burnt during an attempt to steal money from an ATM in Pimpri Chinchwad on Sunday. Police added that the accused tried to cut open the ATM machine using a gas cutter. However, the machine caught fire and the money inside it was burnt. Two CCTV cameras and some furniture were also damaged.

400.title: RBL Bank shares drop by 18% after appointment of new MD & CEO
400.article_body: Shares of RBL Bank tanked by 18% in Monday's early trade to their 52-week low of ₹92.9 after the appointment of the bank's new MD and CEO. On Saturday, R Subramaniakumar was announced as the bank's MD and CEO for a period of three years, six months after Vishwavir Ahuja stepped down from the position due to the RBI's intervention.

401.title: Car with 5 who went for parathas in Murthal rams truck in Delhi; 2 die
401.article_body: Two persons were killed and three others injured after their car rammed into a stationary truck in Delhi's Swaroop Nagar. The deceased have been identified as Sachin Sapra and Ram Kumar, both aged 26. According to the police, the friends drove to Murthal to have parathas and the accident occurred while they were returning.

402.title: 51-yr-old man sells newborn grandson for ₹60,000 in K’taka’s Davanagere
402.article_body: Four persons were arrested for selling a newborn baby boy for ₹60,000 in Karnataka’s Davanagere, officials said. "A 19-year-old woman…gave birth to a baby boy on June 6," SP, Davanagere, CB Ryshyanth, said. The woman's 51-year-old father sold the baby for ₹60,000, he added. "We got back the baby and handed him to the child welfare commission," the SP stated.

403.title: Sensex falls over 1,400 points to trade at 52,843, Nifty below 15,800
403.article_body: BSE Sensex crashed over 1,400 points to 52,843 and Nifty dipped by 417 points to 15,784 in Monday's early trade. Falling up to 4.02%, Bajaj twins, ICICI Bank and SBI were the top Sensex losers. Notably, the Rupee hit an all-time low after it crossed 78 per US dollar for the first time ever in Monday's early trade.

404.title: Haryana man signals petrol pump staff about being kidnapped in SUV, 2 held
404.article_body: Two people were arrested after a man from Ambala, while being kidnapped in his own SUV along with his friend, signalled petrol pump staff of the situation. The victim, Sanjeev Kumar, said three men had taken lift in SUV. One of the men then pointed a knife at Sanjeev and his friend and demanded ₹50 lakh to let them go.
